storyInfo: Kargereich is on the verge of collapse, and the Twin Empresses force into the Witch King's Spire to save Zwillingstürme. They must defeat him once again.

attributes.content: Phew—! You scared me...
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: Vivian, what are you hiding under the covers for... are you writing a letter?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Shh—Tante Cora's about to come. She'll be angry if she sees me awake this late.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: Who are you writing to?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Vati.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: I pestered Tante Cora for two weeks before she finally agreed to sneak me out to a poetry recital at Ludwigs-Universität, and I want to tell Vati all about it.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: I was going write it tomorrow, but I'm afraid it'll be too late by the time we get back...
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: Not that I have any way to send them. I'll just store them somewhere safe, along with all my knight novels.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: But why?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Since I decided not to eat candy anymore, I have to put away those childish fantasies too.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: But didn't you always want to be like those knights? With their shining swordspears sparkling like the sun? Didn't you want to visit that radiant, glowing country?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: They're too far. It's all just too far away.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: Mutti's not here anymore, and Vati, he's by himself. I'm... on my own too. I don't want to be too far from him.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: I asked Tante Cora how long it'd take for us to get back to Sturmland from Zwillingstürme. The fastest route would be only two days, so if Vati needs me, I can always—
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: But your Vati doesn't even know you stayed behind.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: He'd definitely be mad if he did.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: But I don't regret my choice. I begged Tante Cora to help me stay here in Leithanien, instead of following her to the Grand Knight Territory like he told me to.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: Even if I have to hide. Even if he can never know.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: Tante's helped us so much. My Mutti said she's super strong, super brave, and super gentle...
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: But even so, I'm sure she needs people by her side too.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: She's always been by herself. I can't do much, but I can at least hold her hand.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: Mhm. I know exactly what you mean.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.text: I can't say you've made a bad choice. You're giving up on more things, but at the very least you'll have fewer regrets.

attributes.content: It's Tante Cora... I think someone's stopped her to talk.
attributes.name: Vivian

attributes.content: I'll go take a look.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You should get to bed.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: A rare event. Has the Twin Empresses' favorite actually come here of her own accord, to meet with us 'dregs'?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Finally made up your mind?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: All because of the Hochberg girl?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Viviana is too sensible for her own good.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: She takes after both Lucinda and Werner. If I had a daughter myself, I can only hope she'd be as tough and kindhearted as her.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: That day in the car, she suddenly begged me to let her stay. And I thought, maybe things would work out better this way.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Better for Werner, and... better for me.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: With her around, I can feel myself gradually calming down this time.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: When I pass by Karl Schmidt Street, sometimes I feel like I can see the marigolds again, blooming all over the street. As if the flowering season will never end.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: But her current situation says it all.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: As grand a Kurfürst as he may have been, he was incapable of saving his own beloved daughter.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Leithanian's illness still constrains all those who have sacrificed everything for the country's so-called rebirth. Its terminal rot has lived and strived, barring the citizens from their freedom.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Still, I'm elated to hear that her presence here has helped you come to a decision, Concertmaster.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: No! Cora, I didn't come here to—
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: This shouldn't be happening!
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Everything before her eyes dissipates. Once again, Viviana finds herself on the spiral staircase.
She had thought that an earlier solace would prevent the inevitable, so that tragedies wouldn't have to fall upon the lamentable woman behind the door.
Or, at the very least, that she could say her goodbyes before it was too late.
Countless doors simultaneously open up before her. They line up in succession, meandering towards an unclear horizon.
She recalls every Viviana who was behind each of the doors. She sees every candle and its firelight through each of the frames.
Her parents—or perhaps she herself—make a different choice each time. Life after life, possibility after possibility.
If Mutti and Vati didn't have to hide their love for each other... If everyone had accepted us, then maybe they'd all have blessed my birth instead.
attributes.name: Vivian?

attributes.content: Could we have been happy forever?
attributes.name: Vivian?

attributes.content: If Vati could manage to rid himself of all his identities and duties, and live a simple, ordinary life with Mutti...
attributes.name: Vivian?

attributes.content: Could we have gotten a much better ending?
attributes.name: Vivian?

attributes.content: If you'd contacted McKee sooner, and used the K.G.C.C.'s resources to return to Sturmland even just a day earlier...
attributes.name: Viviana?

attributes.content: Could you have at least seen him one last time?
attributes.name: Viviana?

attributes.content: If people could see you as someone ordinary, looked at you without scrutiny, mockery, or pity...
attributes.name: Viviana?

attributes.content: If you'd found a more perfect image, or just the right words... If you'd written of the brilliant marigolds and gentle silhouettes before you...
attributes.name: Viviana?

attributes.content: If you could just... be accompanied by books in peace...
attributes.name: Viviana?

attributes.content: Would it have been less painful?
attributes.name: Viviana?

attributes.content: You deserve a better life than this, Viviana.
attributes.name: Cora?

attributes.content: If there really is one.
attributes.name: Cora?

attributes.content: But why? Why does every last one...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...leave me so disappointed?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Viviana hears the sound of something moving. Doors collapse, distant but clear, like snow losing its grip on a mountain top. The beginning of an avalanche.
Is there such a thing as a second chance?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: She walks towards the nearest door. A new one, just like every other she has walked into.
Will there be a better choice behind this door? A more satisfying resolution? Fewer regrets?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: With that in mind, she has already opened the door.
The Genesis... This 'Zwillingstürme' space is extremely unstable, Yulia Schüler. Your premonition was correct.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I understand that you won't leave...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: So please stick to the resonance pipes as much as possible to keep yourself safe.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What about you, Herr Executor?
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: I must find Arturia. The sooner, the better.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Frau Giallo should have already met the person she wanted to.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: She is a dangerous individual, and should come back with me to Laterano.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But if she truly seeks the Witch King, then she could be in danger right now.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Federico turns around and looks into the distance.
Ever since Yulia activated the retrofitted resonance pipes, the scenery around them has gradually cleared up, both near and far.
And with that, Arturia's destination is no longer in question.
At the far edge of his sight stands a gigantic black tower, interwoven with scarlet and surrounded by a cluster of spires he's never seen before.
Herr Executor, before we go our separate ways, can you tell me how Jan is doing these days?
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: He has encountered some common growing pains.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Loris Bordin left him a sum of money, but judging by his own wishes, he may very well leave Leithanien and make a living in another country.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That's fine too.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: That boy's head has always been swimming with ideas.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: Seniora Schüler, you appear to have more questions for me.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The Caprinae woman quickens her footsteps just slightly as Federico continues at his usual pace, giving her a slight lead.
Loris, is he...
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: ...already dead?
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: I never said—
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Herr Executor, you're clearly the type to dive headfirst into your work without a second thought.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: But you seem particularly concerned with my affairs. You wouldn't willingly put your mission on hold like this for no reason.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: I've heard from Loris how Laterano's Notarial Hall works, and—
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: His will.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Prior to Das Kaiserinnensfest, Loris Bordin died in the sewers near Bodenshof's Forest Park, while trying to prevent the Witch King's remains from inciting a revolt.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: His final message before death was a phone call in which he expressed his hope that someone else would take over the Yulia Schüler case.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: For fifteen years, he resented the city of Zwillingstürme, loathed his work at the Gendarmerie, and treated everything apart from his final battle with indifference.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: His sole preoccupation was your case. And as a former citizen of Laterano, his final request can be considered his last will and testament.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That said, the case has now been solved, and it is no longer possible to investigate any further... But I did find a letter addressed to you in his residence.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I read it only once, but I have it memorized. I can recite it to you if necessary.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: However, the contents are full of rather emotional expressions.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Such as: 'When I decided to get to the bottom of your case, that gross monster summoned me to his office.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: 'He slapped me in the face and said', Leithanian expletive omitted, 'Don't you dare think your military success gives you the right to pick fights with everyone.'
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: 'Yulia, I hate Zwillingstürme. I hate that I'm unable to—'
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Herr Executor, Loris wasn't that sort of man.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: Yulia interrupts Federico's recital.
The Loris I know was never the type to call himself a 'hero' or anything like that.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: But he was the first soldier to set foot in the Witch King's Spire.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: He was the only fool to join the Gendarmerie and silently protect the city, despite owning a title.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: The only officer willing to defy the nobles to protect civilians.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: He knew things weren't perfect in either Laterano or Leithanien, and that many things needed changing.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: But someone harboring hope in their heart will never give in to despair.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: ...Never.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: Yulia stops in her tracks and begins mumbling to herself. Federico follows suit and looks at her quivering shoulders from behind. He does not move.
The young executor listens in silence, attempting to analyze the emotions in her words.
Seniora Schüler, are you... disappointed with Loris Bordin?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: In truth, he was only—
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I'm not.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: I'm not, Herr Executor. I just... feel sorry for him.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: I'm the reason he became like that, right? But I was actually—
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: A pipe organ suddenly sounds from the distance, followed by a huge energy pulse.
Federico subconsciously pulls out his gun.
...going to accept his proposal.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: Federico turns back to Yulia.
An insipid mist flits through his hands, and the Caprinae woman before his eyes no longer exists. Only nothingness remains, as it always has been.
He suddenly recalls the flower from the Sanctilaminium Ambrosii. Back then, he felt that that flower could be the answer to his confusion.
Now, he finds himself in a similar situation, with no one in front of him.
The primary difference is that he is still unable to comprehend the truth of the situation and place he is in—a place devoid of laws or solid footing, only endless dangers and unknowns.
This was Yulia Schüler's second 'death.' My preliminary deduction is that she was caught in a wave of abnormal energy caused by a violent impact to the Genesis Horn.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I will move to verify the precise cause immediately.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: In short, this too was an accident.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: An accident that has once again destroyed her life, and once again she was unable to react in time.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Federico is an outstanding executor. He has been with the Notarial Hall for seven years, and carried the title of Saint for two.
He calls himself an executioner and executor, and has witnessed countless deaths, but this is the first time that he's truly sensed someone's emotions in their final moments.
She lived in her own 'Zwillingstürme' for an eternity, as she loved and regretted. Even death was unable to shake her belief in life.
Simple.
But intense.
Your silence ails me, Sankta.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Yulia, she...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The twins created by Leopold and Fremont are currently attempting to brute force their way into my Pavillon.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Frail consciousnesses cannot withstand the resulting energy waves.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: No, it's not just her...?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Arturia turns around, even though there is nothing else to see.
Suddenly, the energy blows away a layer of mist like a breeze, revealing the breathing, footsteps, joy, and grief hidden beneath.
These emotions are now—no, they've always been here, all over the Pavillon.
If a soul is like an instrument, then at this very moment she feels the vibration of countless strings, a chorus.
I could only see Yulia because of my acquaintance with Loris, and I had only brief contact with her.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But there are so many ordinary souls 'living' inside your palace.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: They exist as information, and walk as Leithanians.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Form and identity. Nothing more.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: But reminiscing is a luxury I do not allow in my Pavilion, Sankta.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: I believe you came to verify a future?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: I think... I've already gotten my confirmation, in a way.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Why, exactly, do people develop a 'self'? And how does one become strong enough to go up against an approaching crisis, or a predestined doom?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We all exist within 'order.'
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Rules and commandments serve as Laterano's anchors and cables, enabling faith to traverse the entire lands and providing a target for the prayers of believers. The law is our piety.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: 'Leithanien,' However, is the result of Güldenesgesatz. Through its systems, aesthetics, models, and morals, ten different regions with no common cultural identity joined together as a unity that has lasted a thousand years.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Experience inherited through generations, laws forged in writing, concepts established by convention...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: These exist a priori, and from it, an 'order' is formed. They guide how we should think, speak, and deal with ourselves as well as others.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...And so it becomes our instinct, engraved into our very flesh and blood.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But the order has its imperfections. It is rigid, unequal, and indifferent. It separates us.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Laterano's order offers redemption to its believers, but the gates of Paradise do not open for the Sarkaz. It refuses to provide bread for their empty stomachs or roofs to shelter them from the rain.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Ægir and Iberia face the same dangerous ocean, but their respective orders forbid them to keep watch at the same lighthouse.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Our order rebels against us, and we yearn for it still, calling for its perfection.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...Only 'order' is desired.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Laterano's laws hover barely above a hundred words, and Leithanien's theme has long been concise.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Their minds shallow. Their pride false. Their senses dull.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: They regard only the dead as eternal. By this they are timid, yet also fearless.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: What is your answer then, Sankta? What do you desire?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: ...'Emotion'.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We exist in the 'present,' a river whose running flow is our feelings, our discordant and capricious reflections of the moment we are living in.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Feelings build into emotion, and emotions shape our souls.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Our emotions are varied and profound. We are the love, the hatred, the appreciation, and the lament we harbor when these emotions call upon our reflection, and through these encounters we come to understand life itself.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: They were the torch we wielded to repel the shadow of death long before the birth of laws, religion, politics, or science. We were born as prodigies in utilizing our emotions.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: And thus, we are connected.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Are you referring to the empathy between the Sankta?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Indeed.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Language is not without its limit, and what it finds an impossible chasm to leap over, empathy arches across in an emotion's quiver. It's a precious gift to my kin, through which we can read each other's feelings.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But it is also utterly unfair. Its creeds are too vague, and its benediction too narrow, like a rule written only to serve Laterano's order.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: So you crave a 'true empathy?'
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: You seek an empathy from within, with a wider yet deeper range than what you call 'emotion,' that connects everyone on all lands as one?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: An interesting delusion, Sankta.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: I've searched, I've tried... and failed.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Would you imagine it? In a dilapidated monastery, Sankta and Sarkaz had been fighting side-by-side against life's miseries and their own wavering faith, all to protect a hard-earned garden?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But when true disaster came knocking at our doors, we found that our 'kin,' who had understood and accepted us for six decades, still harbored doubts in their hearts, fissures in their faiths. We were always strangers, nothing more.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Emotions are as real as the fragility of our minds.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We are good at avoiding pain, experts, even, at muting ourselves on it. Conversely, this helps mask our own feebleness.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: As a result, people cannot feel what others feel. Tragedies will always transpire as long as this barrier remains.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: And you and your music endeavor to unshackle people by confronting them with their true hearts, just as one would polish an instrument on sandpaper.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: You attempt to strengthen their souls by guiding them through their regrets.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Is this the duty you have long since imposed upon yourself to perform?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Yes, Your Majesty.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Because to this day, I have been seeking confirmation.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I have a future in mind.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Continue.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: In that future, everyone possesses a most powerful soul.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Our strengths are unequal, unlike yours, where a tenacious soul can't be shaken by anything in this mortal realm, and even death is powerless to wipe away your struggles, pursuits, and conquests.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Others are like those Cora, Yulia, or the souls in the palace. They are unconcerned with greater undertakings, and simply love the lives they live—but still they dare to fight against the turbulent waves that are engulfing them.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Of course, we will persist in our pursuit of happiness, but more importantly, we will no longer avoid pain, or be ashamed of it.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We, as people, should suffer, and we will suffer.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Our apathy, doubt, confusion, remorse, shame, grief... These complex emotions will no longer leave scars deep in our hearts, nor will they remain untouchable beyond the realm of words.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We will no longer shy away from self-expression, nor will we struggle to find ways to do so.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We will understand how to live with ourselves, and live strong we will.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Sankta, the results of your performances are often unsatisfactory. You should know that for most, emotions are inadequate guidelines, and wholly following one's heart will only lead to dire consequences.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Crafty is the Creator, who, for each house built, has orchestrated a blizzard that brings its ruination.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Yet you hope for your future to include... everyone?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: An amusing delusion.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: No, Your Majesty—it must include everyone.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Indeed, your existence is an exception to the laws and reasons that govern these great lands.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Born from order, yet ruling over it, your incredible personality, formidable strength, boundless knowledge, adventurous spirit, and subversive insight... all condensed into an essence of one.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You have glimpsed beyond the horizon of perception into the black woods of mystery, and even wield the power to traverse the unknown in your hand.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But they are also the root of your madness, your downfall...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: These extraordinary qualities, and the nigh unattainable achievements built upon them; they cease to exist with your demise.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It's a cage trapping us all, and we should not expect any individual to break it open, however powerful its soul is.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Therefore, everyone needs a strong soul, they need the power to 'empathize.'
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We will be able to share our knowledge, our experiences, our abilities and insights, all via our emotional bonds.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Then, there would be no crisis able to undo our ties, no defeat able to wear down our rapport.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: There will be no truths unrevealable, no pain incomprehensible, no obstruction unsurpassable. Our power comes from our individual strengths.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: We would be distinctly ourselves, yet as one.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: And when adversity and the unknown are at the gate, they would find our sanctuary unbreakable, as our collective emotions have formed a wall of steel.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Thus I am here. If a 'strong soul' can truly exist, strong enough to resist a predestined doom, then by no means should I ignore it—the future.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Much have you witnessed and experienced, and devoted you are to the power of emotions.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Why, then, did you not seek it from yourself, Sankta?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Are you... reading my mind?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You've been doing this from the moment I arrived at your throne... Is this your 'performance'?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: A performance that befits a performer like you, pilgrim.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Everything in my Pavillon, I command at will. They are mine.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Accumulated guilt?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Unreconcilable sorrow?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Hopeless disappointment?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Powerful courage?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Endless regret?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Unwavering affection?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: There is no 'performance.' No performance will allow such cruelty and arbitrary.
You do not come to a common understanding, nor are his joy and sorrow yours. You have thrown open the gate to your mind, and he is the guest and the host.
Leithanian history has recorded how the Witch King reformed and rearranged his people, his orchestra and army. Disobedience is not tolerated nor possible.
Sankta. If emotions had forms, by all rights you should be the fullest individual I have ever met.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: But I sense in you nothing. Why?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Because you use yourself as a mirror, reflecting the emotions of others. Nein, you do not see and tell. You receive.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: You are a receptacle whose content is overflowing with the emotions of others, with no room for your own. You feel what they feel, but at the same time feel nothing.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: You undo the knots of others while further tightening yours, a state that resembles only chaos.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Arturia feels a pair of hands on her.
They stretch into the lakebed of her consciousness, and do not stop there, but stir up the mud at the bottom, arriving at the void in the very depths.
Suffocation resembles a rushing river, scrubbing every nook and cranny of her consciousness as it thoroughly engulfs her within.
Hm?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: I see.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: I saw your only truth.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: The Witch King remains silent for a long time as he stares at the person before his throne.
Arturia has never felt her heart beat as fast as it is now.
Sankta, the future you describe does have its value.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Perhaps it will find its place in the river of time.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: However, you are the one person furthest from your utopia.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: If you are just a receptacle, just a mirror, if you cannot even see the reality you have neglected...
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Then you have reached your end, before your path has yet to reach its.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Your Majesty...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Your audience is over, Sankta.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Your request I will not answer.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Now, bear witness to my end.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: New guests at my Pavillon. Very well. Come forward, twins.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: I recognize you both.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: At first, a pipe organ hums in the distance, its sound reaching the throne loud and clear.
A gentle shade of gold follows. Like a splotch of rich ink soaking into view, the color climbs over the palace walls before melting the Pavilion down.
Brilliant rays of light dye the clouds aureate, and Zwillingstürme's glowing sunset illuminates the black spire that had long ceased to exist.
You truly are attached to that throne, Herkunftshorn.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Twenty-three years ago, when Hildegard and I made our way here, you were sitting on it just as you are now.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Summoned here late at night by a creed, your subjects crawled beneath the steps as your melody shredded their souls away, not daring to make one move. You were disinclined to even take notice of them.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Judging by your attire... you have both proclaimed yourselves the Kaiserinnen of Leithanien?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: The blades painstakingly forged by the nobles are now pointing back at them, freshly resharpened.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: How amusing.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: I won't deny you. Lieselotte and I were born from your Arts. Our flesh and blood, as well as our power, were born from the nobles' boring ambitions. Indeed, we are only creations.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: But precisely because of that, we can be loyal only to Leithanien.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Answer, then: how did you serve the Leithanien you are devoted to?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Hildegard and I do not judge ourselves by our merits, Herkunftshorn.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: But at the very least, when the people of Zwillingstürme lift their heads, they should be able to see a brilliant sunset, instead of dark clouds brimming with the metallic tinge of blood.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: That is our dream, and what we work towards.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: How naive.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Do you wish to continue indulging yourselves in the illusions you weaved, and enshrouding your minds from the truth?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Humanity is shackled by repulsive rules. Our legs cannot walk. Our eyes cannot see.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: And what kind of future can you possibly bestow to Leithanien, given your wayward minds and narrow sights?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Is the Witch King, who nearly drove Leithanien to the brink, actually rebuking us for our incompetence in giving her a future?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Lieselotte, we don't have much time.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: We've performed together on every one of the twenty-three celebrations of Leithanien's rebirth, and your skills have never faltered. I hope I can put the same trust in your combat practice.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: You and Leithanien have my shield, Hildegard.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: I admire your experience, courage, and achievements, Herkunftshorn. You overthrew prejudice and the old order—more firmly entrenched than the Spires are now—and brought opportunity to every Leithanian.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: You gave the nation unprecedented vitality, and were to be revered as the greatest monarch in its history.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: But then you pushed the country into war, erected even more terrifying spires, and inflicted suffering a hundred times more painful to the very people you had given hope to. You were ruined by your own desires.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Herkunftshorn, our widespread standards, our harmonious melodies, and our arts and morals make Leithanien what she is.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: But you rocked her foundations, undermined her survival, and made her your own vassal.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Your meddling turned the entire country into a resource to be exploited. And it is only righteous that everything you have explored or mastered belongs to Leithanien.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: So we're here to retrieve it.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: A spire that remains only as a shadow should not exist in the first place. To think it actually lingered over Leithanien these past twenty-three years.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: What did you call it earlier... your 'Pavillon'? A palace?
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: No matter. Today will be your last, and this place shall serve as your final grave.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Originium clusters surge from thin air, first hitting Grimmacht's blade before fragments splash onto Ewigegnade's shield.
Black and red unite into one. A dazzling gold. An intense purple.

Their Arts are condensed to their very limits, like unchangeable, primitive blocks of color. They collide, but cannot blend into each other, and only splash before the throne, seizing every inch of space.
An ear-splitting rhythm accompanies the explosion of colors. Their weapons, originally instruments, perform two movements in two completely different styles, at the same time and place.
Brass, woodwinds, strings, percussion, keyboards, and even bell trees, as well as death whistles...

The rusty reeds beneath Sargon's golden sands, the flame-wreathed amber under the sludge of the Black Flow, the rootless flowers buried deep in the frostbound soil of Sami, and the boundless chaos itself in this Kargereich...

A cosmos coexists with its voice within the Witch King's melody. Notes are woven, conducted, and played by his hand, notes to sing a melody of the 'Witch King,' notes to sing a melody for the 'Witch King.'
This mortal realm will never again know a symphony this clamorous, harsh, and illogical, yet also spectacular, majestic, and striking.
Ewigegnade and Grimmacht's duet is so simple in comparison.
The notes gently rise and sharply fall, with the dignified and imposing pipe organ resembling a castle encircled by mountains, while the ethereal violin is like a waterfall pouring by the citadel.
The sound of water splashing onto rock is still clearly audible in the room furthest from the waterfall, but even in the closest it does not sound so noisy.
The two act like one, their movements as harmonious as if they had never split.

The symphonies sing a war song: two generations of Leithanian Kaisers fight before the throne, the entire Pavillon both their sand table and military formation. History bends and rewinds at this moment—
Gaul's flagship crosses the river valley under Corsica I's lead, soldiers bumping shoulders as they form a thick cloud and tear apart Sturmland's iron curtain-like defense line.

And then, Herkunftshorn's silhouette introduces its reign at the pinnacle. He stands atop the Spire, heaven and earth at his beck and call. The elements, thunderbolts, and sandstorms are all at his disposal—
To swallow everything.
Under the omnipresent dust clouds of blood, Ewigegnade and Grimmacht's movements are unremarkable.
They sneak into Vedunien under the cover of night and with a feint from the Kurfürsten's coalition army, and make a beeline for the Spire.
The Spire opens its doors, welcoming its visitors. The unsuspecting spire casters rush into formation, and one by one turn into the red leaves of late autumn.
Shield and sword shatter the Genesis Spire.
Just like that night twenty-three years ago.
My Pavillon, and everything in it, are disintegrating, dying.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: The Pavillon... This imperishable hall is not my creation, nor the work of anyone else.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: It is the accumulation of mankind's immeasurable sacrifices.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Technology, arts, evolutionary experience—every choice, every regret, every affection, and every resentment. Every hope and every despair.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Every thought and every prayer, the birth and death of every civilization, everything remembered and everything forgotten.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: The Pavillon is humanity.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: The Pavillon is our will.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Through annihilation the will has taken form, and from chaos the order was given birth.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: A will true to reveal the origin. A will firm to conquer the source.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Originium.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: The beginning of annihilation and the source of chaos were both mine to wield, and thus I compelled Originium to reveal the nature of its being, to present the fact of its origin.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: But I became aware that no matter how Originium grows, overwrites, recreates...
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: It speaks the same truth, a truth laid bare right before our eyes all along.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: It says the creator who was at the source of making was also a creation.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: It says the dominator reigned long before its domain came to exist.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: It says hope is lost, and eternity is no more.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: And what truth did I obtain but heavier chains, and a more ruthless resolve at the origin, the root of all creation?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Undeniable as the silence of death. Unextinguishable as the light of stars.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Cruel was the maker. Vile was the maker. Sly was the maker.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: By his hands our determination was shattered, but not annulled; maimed, but not overthrown.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: It forged our sharpest sword. It built our toughest prison.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: The truth is laid bare for all to see, but how can a seeker challenge the truth with their volition and sanity splintered?
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Let the truth be seen by all eyes. Let the reason be heard to all ears.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Your determination has guided you to my Pavilion. More will follow.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: You will see in me a nightmare, a traitor to freedom, a... tyrant.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: But if the Genesis Spire has failed to reach the boundary with its thrust, then a pioneer must be there to step foot on a place beyond space and time.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: If the root of all creation poses nothing but shackles, then we shall be the hands holding its chains.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: If the Creator has willed the extinction of his creation...
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Then we shall be the bell to toll his demise.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Void cannot and will not be the truth. I will never allow it, nor will I excuse it.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Harken well Herkunftshorn's ultimate vision, his sin, his final will:
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: The Creator must perish.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: I see that your power has grown since our last meeting, twins.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: The portion of Herkunftshorn which he discarded long ago is standing before him.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: But you have perceived not yourselves, and known not... freedom. You have relinquished... humanity.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: I had hoped Leithanien's sword and shield to be more than weapons.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Heed, my audience.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: You have come before the throne to seek an answer, to pass down a verdict.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Only a man's answer can sate his kin. Only a monarch's verdict can convict his equals.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: If you succeed, if you stand fast till the very end, you must see what I didn't, and be what I wasn't.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Hope may be gone. Enternity may be lost.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Their dearth mark but the end of Herkunftshorn, a monarch's downfall.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Leithanien shall stand, whose light will outshine the tallest beacon of hope.
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: Leithanien shall live, whose name will outlast the longest river of time!
attributes.name: Witch King

attributes.content: He sees a rhapsody. He roars a fanfare. He demands a concerto. Now thunders have joined the chorus.
